title: Southampton v Leicester betting odds: Foxes away win tempting
text:
A Leicester City victory could see them overtake Manchester City and go second in the Premier League but they must overcome a Southampton side in desperate need of a win

Saints need to start marching

Southampton are nine games into the season and already the alarm bells are ringing after a patchy start.

The Saints are 17th in the table on eight points and have a record of two wins, two draws and five defeats.

A loss against Leicester could see them drop into the relegation zone by the end of the weekend, piling more pressure on manager Ralph Hasenhuttl.

Part of the problem is home form. Their two wins have both been away, at Brighton in August and Sheffield United in September.

A Southampton win is 11/5 with William Hill while another option is a Double Chance at 4/7.

Southampton struggle at home while Foxes let goals in on the road

Taking on teams residing in the top half of the table at home has been a problem for Hasenhuttl’s side.

Liverpool, Chelsea and Bournemouth all left St Mary’s with convincing wins and scored a combined nine goals.

Southampton have conceded 16 goals this season and have managed only two clean sheets.

Leicester have scored 16 goals this season but they tend to concede goals on the road.

The Foxes have managed one win, a draw and two defeats away from home in the Premier League and have failed to keep a clean sheet on their travels.

William Hill are offering 17/10 on over 2.5 goals while both teams to score is 8/11.

Leicester are not in love with Fridays

Leicester have an extremely poor record when it comes to playing in the Premier League on a Friday night.

The Foxes have played seven, winning none, drawing two and losing five times.

This may give Saints fans some hope and William Hill offer a Draw No Bet at 11/10.

Vardy’s form should frighten Saints

Jamie Vardy has picked up his form since Brendan Rogers took over as Leicester manager in February.

The former England striker currently boasts his best goals-per-minute ratio under any manager for Leicester, netting every 113 minutes.

He already has six goals to his name this season and scored the equaliser in the Foxes’ last outing against Burnley.

William Hill have Vardy to score first at 4/1 and a win cast of Vardy to score any time and Leicester to win is 21/10.
description: Betting preview as Leicester could overtake Manchester City into second in the Premier League, but must overcome a Southampton side in desperate need of a win.
